resources.string: Welcome to the Rhythm library sample app!
This app demonstrates the capabilities of the library and how it can be used in a real project. You are welcome to examine its source code on GitHub.
Heads up! If you see this, and the text in this sample is not aligned nicely to the 4dp baseline grid, please file an issue on GitHub with the screenshot and your device model. Thank you.
— says designer marshmallow. Do you agree with her?

Open the Notification drawer to access Rhythm Quick Control, which allows you to cycle through configurations without leaving your current screen. Go ahead and play around with overlays for different provided groups.
As of v0.9, there are three spec layer types available out of the box for you to combine and make various overlays. Click the button to learn more.

string-array.name: bullet_points
string-array.item: Horizontal and vertical grid lines, repeating at a fixed step, with optional offset and margins. Add two grid line layers to make a grid.\n
Guides of arbitrary color and thickness, to make keylines and highlights.\n
Dimensions label, to inspect view’s dimensions at glance.\n
More spec layer types coming soon; meanwhile feel free to create your custom ones and show them to me!

resources.string: While controlling overlays from the notification is convenient, sometimes you simply don’t need it. With Rhythm you can explicitly create unlinked groups, new drawables and overlays, and assign them programmatically (see the source).
It’s not much yet, but if you already love this library and pictured how it would help you tremendously with your next project, motor over to GitHub to learn how you can support the developer. ♥
